physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Tender, irregular, shallow ulcerated lesion on the left ventral surface of the tongue; mobile, smooth, tender lymph node in the left anterior cervical chain; scattered areas of erythema and blisters on the lower legs; cloudy blister on the right foot with 5 mm surrounding erythema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The tongue lesion increased in size with an exudate; lymphadenopathy was unchanged.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Palpable, tender lymph nodes, 1 to 2 cm in diameter in the submandibular and anterior cervical regions; raised lesion (1.5 cm in diameter) near the tip of the ventral surface of the tongue, with a white film and surrounding erythema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The lesion slightly increased in size.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Examination showed a well-defined, low-density lesion on the ventral surface of the left tongue on CT scan; enlarged cervical lymph nodes up to 2.3 cm.
On follow-up examination, the tongue lesion had healed and the lymphadenopathy had resolved.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressed from an ulcerated lesion to healing.
